description: How should the user interface interact with domain concepts?
question: What is your default approach for UI-domain interaction?

options.name: Direct Domain Binding
options.description: UI binds directly to domain objects. Changes to domain reflected in UI and vice versa.
options.when_to_use: Simple forms, domain model matches UI closely, rapid prototyping, desktop apps

options.name: View Model / Presenter Layer
options.description: Separate view models tailored for UI needs. Translate between domain and UI representation.
options.when_to_use: Complex UI logic, domain doesn't match UI, multiple views of same data, MVVM/MVP patterns
example: Get formatted total: String (formats Money for display)

options.name: DTO Transfer Objects
options.description: Data Transfer Objects carry data between UI and domain layers. Explicit mapping at boundaries.
options.when_to_use: API-first design, serialization concerns, versioning, cross-platform clients

options.name: Application Service Layer
options.description: Application services orchestrate use cases. UI calls services, services coordinate domain objects.
options.when_to_use: Complex workflows, transaction management, authorization, multiple UI channels
example: (UI calls service methods, service coordinates domain)

options.name: Command/Query Handlers
options.description: Separate handlers for commands (actions) and queries (reads). UI sends commands, receives query results.
options.when_to_use: CQRS architecture, complex authorization, audit logging, mediator pattern
